Identified a user authentication feature of a web application with a SQL injection vulnerability allowing unescaped user input
Crafted a malicious SQL query to check if a user with a specific username and password existed in the database using the vulnerable input field
Determined if the query was successful by the time it took for the application to respond without returning visible results or error messages
Bypassed the user authentication and gained access to the system
Performed various actions such as accessing sensitive data and modifying the website content
Recommended that the application implement proper input validation and sanitation techniques to prevent SQL injection attacks
Recommended that the application implement proper error handling techniques to prevent blind SQL injection attacks
